intro: Clidemia micrantha, commonly known as littleleaf mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its small, white to pinkish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Its leaves are usually opposite and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Clidemia micrantha is often found in disturbed habitats and can be invasive in certain areas.
